An "Auditor" is simply a standard OCI container. We inject these auditors as sidecars into your Pod for seamless, standards-based integration.

Use our SDK to transform scripts into compliant Auditors that fit your policies.

Technical Implementation

Never trust  —  Always verify

Your code runs inside a secure enclave. The CPU itself prevents the OS, hypervisor, or cloud admin from accessing memory.

01

Confidential Computing

Wrap your current PyTorch and TensorFlow applications in our Sovereign Containers with zero code changes. Utilizing the hardware-based isolation of Intel SGX and AMD SEV, our solution guarantees that client data remains invisible to the host infrastructure.

02

Attestable Audit Chains

Our TEE-based attestable audit layer allows for full-weight analysis and safety benchmarking, without compromise, while ensuring that proprietary model architecture remains cryptographically sealed.

03

Sovereignty Certificates

Our verifier service appraises cryptographic evidence and identity assertions, while deriving physical location assurance from latency-based RTT measurements.

Publish Your Own Auditor in Minutes

An Auditor is just a standard OCI container. Write your logic in Python, push to our marketplace, and it's ready to be chained. View SDK Documentation →

Example Auditor

sovereignty_auditor.py 
import lucid.auditor as auditor

# Pin execution to Swedish nodes
@auditor.on_request
def enforce_sovereignty(request):
    if request.node.country != "SE":
        return auditor.Deny("Sovereignty Breach")
    return auditor.Proceed()

# Redact sensitive data from responses
@auditor.on_response
def clean_output(response):
    if response.contains_pii():
        return auditor.Redact()
    return auditor.Proceed()
